title: Open Letter to the Unvaccinated From 8 Doctors, page 2
cleaned_text:
originally posted by: incoserv 

 

originally posted by: OtherSideOfTheCoin 

 Any time i see somethin like this i like to look at who these "Doctors" actually are. 

 

 Angela Durante, PhD She's a Nurse 

 

 Denis Rancourt, PhD He is a Physicist 

 

 Claus Rinner PhD , he is a Geologist 

 

 Laurent Leduc, PhD, couldn't find much but according to this is a Leadership scholar 

 

 Donald Welsh, PhD, Finally i get to someone who is actually at a medical school, but he has been discredited 

 

 John Zwaagstra, PhD, couldn't find much on John, i think he might be a biotech research scientist. 

 

 Then i got bored, point is these are not 8 medical doctors. 

 

 If you had 8 actual working ID doctors i would say....hmmm...intresting, but this is just like 8 randoms with phd's got together to tell us what they think. I have a mate with a phd in something to do with music, am not gonna ask him for advice about my health. 

 

 This letter is not at is core about medical advice; it is about basic God granted human rights and essential civil liberties. Your or anybody else's medical opinion (because that's all that there is now as science is dead) does not trump anybody's inherent and essential rights as a free and autonomous human being. 

 

 If you can't see that, just line up for your next jab ... and your next ... and your next ... and your next ... 

 

 Exactly. 

 

 This is really about the right to refuse medical treatments and the establishment trying to roll the medical laws and some global treaties, back to the 1920s and before, when the medical establishments and eugenicists, of The United States, Canada and Europe, were actively engaged in forcing medical treatments; including force sterilization, on the "undesirables". They were acting in the interest of the greater good of the states and society. It is because of the atrocities of the Eugenics movement, that we have treaties and national laws, that protect us from forced medical treatments. Exactly.This is really about the right to refuse medical treatments and the establishment trying to roll the medical laws and some global treaties, back to the 1920s and before, when the medical establishments and eugenicists, of The United States, Canada and Europe, were actively engaged in forcing medical treatments; including force sterilization, on the "undesirables". They were acting in the interest of the greater good of the states and society. It is because of the atrocities of the Eugenics movement, that we have treaties and national laws, that protect us from forced medical treatments. 







 

 You all act like this is something new. It is not. 

 

 Vaccines to go to certain parts of the world have been forever. 

 

 If you don't get the vaccine, you don't go. If your kid isn't vaccinated, they are not going to school. 

 

 And Amy Coney Barrett just reaffirmed that by refusing to take on the Indiana University mandate. Why? Because this has been precedent for decades. 

 

 So whine if you must, just don't act like any of this is something new. You lost the argument in the Courts a long time ago and just last week.

 

 

 edit on 15-8-2021 by MiddleInsite because: (no reason given)

 You've always had the right to say no to a vaccine. But you won't be getting your kid into school for the LAST 70 YEARS OR SO.You all act like this is something new. It is not.Vaccines to go to certain parts of the world have been forever.If you don't get the vaccine, you don't go. If your kid isn't vaccinated, they are not going to school.And Amy Coney Barrett just reaffirmed that by refusing to take on the Indiana University mandate. Why? Because this has been precedent for decades.So whine if you must, just don't act like any of this is something new. You lost the argument in the Courts a long time ago and just last week. 







originally posted by: OtherSideOfTheCoin 

 Any time i see somethin like this i like to look at who these "Doctors" actually are. 

 

 Angela Durante, PhD She's a Nurse 

 

 Denis Rancourt, PhD He is a Physicist 

 

 Claus Rinner PhD , he is a Geologist 

 

 Laurent Leduc, PhD, couldn't find much but according to this is a Leadership scholar 

 

 Donald Welsh, PhD, Finally i get to someone who is actually at a medical school, but he has been discredited 

 

 John Zwaagstra, PhD, couldn't find much on John, i think he might be a biotech research scientist. 

 

 Then i got bored, point is these are not 8 medical doctors. 

 

 If you had 8 actual working ID doctors i would say....hmmm...intresting, but this is just like 8 randoms with phd's got together to tell us what they think. I have a mate with a phd in something to do with music, am not gonna ask him for advice about my health. 

 

 Hmm lets not pretend they're the only ones though, considering you said you'd might listen if somebody professional in the right field was sounding alarm bells.... well its just a fact tens of thousands of pathologists and virologists and other relevant fields globally are calling BS yet you claim If you had 8 actual working ID doctors i would say....hmmm...intresting so interesting indeed, and also, there are plenty of working drs coming forward, or scared to talk/speak out, and over a period of two years..but thats not at all even a little worrying to you ? i don't believe you, thankfully the majority dont believe them or you, so how many more years should we do this dance? how many hundreds millions of lives are you willing to destroy? and where will you be when the world comes looking for those who destroyed it? 

 

 OH PS... 14 days to flatten the curve Hmm lets not pretend they're the only ones though, considering you said you'd might listen if somebody professional in the right field was sounding alarm bells.... well its just a fact tens of thousands of pathologists and virologists and other relevant fields globally are calling BS yet you claimso interesting indeed, and also, there are plenty of working drs coming forward, or scared to talk/speak out, and over a period of two years..but thats not at all even a little worrying to you ? i don't believe you, thankfully the majority dont believe them or you, so how many more years should we do this dance? how many hundreds millions of lives are you willing to destroy? and where will you be when the world comes looking for those who destroyed it?OH PS... 14 days to flatten the curve 







originally posted by: MiddleInsite 

 

 So whine if you must, just don't act like any of this is something new. You lost the argument in the Courts a long time ago and just last week. 

 

 I won't whine, but I'll say "hell no!" loud and proud as long as I can. 

 

 And if anyone ever forcibly injects a foreign synthetic substance into my body, I will look them in the eye and tell them if I die, my blood is on their hands and they are a murderer. 

 

 If the virus gets me or anyone else, it's all on Mother Nature and humanity's inherent weaknesses. 

 

 If a forced vaccine gets me or anyone else, it's willful killing and it's all on the ones who forced it. I won't whine, but I'll say "hell no!" loud and proud as long as I can.And if anyone ever forcibly injects a foreign synthetic substance into my body, I will look them in the eye and tell them if I die, my blood is on their hands and they are a murderer.If the virus gets me or anyone else, it's all on Mother Nature and humanity's inherent weaknesses.If a forced vaccine gets me or anyone else, it's willful killing and it's all on the ones who forced it. 







 

 “Very good point and i take your point all I am saying is that several of these doctors never actually went to med school.” 

 

 Yet another logical fallacy (‘Appeal to Authority’). Inconserve reply said it best, so I won’t say much more. But I will say this: Human Rights and (what SHOULD be) Common Sense are not limited by ones chosen profession or station if life. 

 

 Remember the little boy who pointed out that the Emperor had no clothes? He wasn’t a fashion editor, so by your logic, he should’ve kept his mouth shut. Remember, ALL the adults and ALL the courtiers were fawning over the Emperors magnificent ‘wardrobe’. All it took to break the spell of lunatic lickspittles delusions was a boy simply pointing out and laughing that the Emperor was naked. a reply to: OtherSideOfTheCoin “Very good point and i take your point all I am saying is that several of these doctors never actually went to med school.”Yet another logical fallacy (‘Appeal to Authority’). Inconserve reply said it best, so I won’t say much more. But I will say this: Human Rights and (what SHOULD be) Common Sense are not limited by ones chosen profession or station if life.Remember the little boy who pointed out that the Emperor had no clothes? He wasn’t a fashion editor, so by your logic, he should’ve kept his mouth shut. Remember, ALL the adults and ALL the courtiers were fawning over the Emperors magnificent ‘wardrobe’. All it took to break the spell of lunatic lickspittles delusions was a boy simply pointing out and laughing that the Emperor was naked. 







originally posted by: MiddleInsite 

 You've always had the right to say no to a vaccine. But you won't be getting your kid into school for the LAST 70 YEARS OR SO. 

 

 You all act like this is something new. It is not. 

 

 Vaccines to go to certain parts of the world have been forever. 

 

 If you don't get the vaccine, you don't go. If your kid isn't vaccinated, they are not going to school. 

 

 And Amy Coney Barrett just reaffirmed that by refusing to take on the Indiana University mandate. Why? Because this has been precedent for decades. 

 

 So whine if you must, just don't act like any of this is something new. You lost the argument in the Courts a long time ago and just last week.

 

 

 

 I am not anti-vaccine and neither were my parents, we took all the vaccines for small pox, polio, measles and all the other ones when I was growing up, but they were tested properly through 4 phases not rushed to market with the warnings the FDA mentioned, they were also approved by the FDA.

 Although I do remember being vaccinated a couple of times in school, something about it made me feel uneasy, never seemed to feel any worse after it, maybe just the way they did it, lined up like cattle in the gymnasium to get our shots. I am not anti-vaccine and neither were my parents, we took all the vaccines for small pox, polio, measles and all the other ones when I was growing up, but they were tested properly through 4 phases not rushed to market with the warnings the FDA mentioned, they were also approved by the FDA.Although I do remember being vaccinated a couple of times in school, something about it made me feel uneasy, never seemed to feel any worse after it, maybe just the way they did it, lined up like cattle in the gymnasium to get our shots.
